Vitamin C is a proven ingredient that delivers results and until recently cost a pretty penny to get a high enough level of vitamin c to make a real difference.<br /><br />I had heard good things and positive reviews about Oz Naturals 20% Vitamin C Serum so it was a no brainer when I went to buy my next bottle. Oz Naturals 20% Serum uses a clinical strength 20% vitamin C and a vegan hyaluronic acid. It also has vitamin E and ferulic acid. The is the perfect cocktail of ingredients for my skin. I absolutely love the vitamin E because it gives you the moisture needed to keep your skin soft. Some serums have left my skin dry, this one does not.<br /><br />It doesn't take long to see results. My skin is very dry and using the serum everyday has given me the youthful glow we all want. If I get lazy and not use a serum, my skin quickly starts to dull. Using a serum constantly, is the only way I have been able to get rid of the discolorations I am dealing with on my cheeks.<br /><br />Overall I am very pleased with the serum.

  167. This product is an absolute joke. Do not buy.<br /><br />(By the way, this is my second time trying to post a review like this. My first one was flagged.)<br /><br />To consumers: Please understand how much effort this company has put into creating false reviews and hype. Once you spend a little time reading them (something I wish I had done before purchasing and returning) and comparing the quantity of reviews to similar products from more established brands, their effort to mislead us is pretty transparent.<br /><br />MORE IMPORTANTLY, TO AMAZON: This type of behavior from sellers should absolutely be prohibited and monitored better. Consumers have enough to study and compare to make smart purchases. We shouldn't have to wade through this type of overtly disingenuous marketing.<br /><br />To those of you reading this who are looking for a quality vitamin C serum, I will say that I've purchased multiple bottles of the Ole Henriksen Truth Serum from Sephora. It's an OK serum in general, but it's only masquerading as a true vitamin C serum. It's not harmful by any means, but it's not really helpful either. After I realized I had been wasting money, I actually looking for a more affordable and effective replacement when I purchased this product. After receiving this low quality item and doing a little more research, I realized that my search wasn't over. I've done a lot of research since about vitamin C serums and the best one I've found is from a Korean company called OST. It's very strong, so while it has lightened my scars and improved overall healing, it has adverse effects too. If used too frequently it will irritate and dry your skin out. I still haven't found the right balance, so I doubt I'll repurchase. I'm only recommending it because it's been the best out of everything I've tried. The search continues.

  203. Skin type: sensitive with slight rosacea<br />age: 57<br /><br />Oz Naturals Vitamin C Serum comes in a small clear bottle with a dropper style application. The serum is fine for daily use and though targeted for &#34;aging&#34; skin, it's for any type of skin. No parabens or alcohol; doesn't clog pores. A thinner serum than some and absorbs very quickly.<br /><br />I do so love this serum - I've used another OZ Natural product and was just as satisfied as I am with this serum. I put a few drops onto my fingertips and work the product into my skin. I suggest that you apply it to your face in sections, because it does absorb very very quickly into your skin. So, for example, I will apply to my forehead and cheekbones, and then add a few more drops to massage into the rest of my face. With what's left on my fingertips, I massage into my neck--sometimes I add a little water before massaging into my neck.<br /><br />The result is that my skin feels and looks amazing. There is no stinging or redness - something I have to be careful of with a product because of my rosacea. However, I also have weird skin that still breaks out even at my age, so some products are just too oily for me - not so with this Oz serum. I often use it morning and night, but mostly at night. It's fine for under make up, or to use alone, but I prefer to add a moisturizer over it, for it does sink so well into the skin that it does beg for a bit more moisture.<br /><br />I can't wait to see the results after continued use!<br /><br />I'll be looking for more Oz Natural products, for they suit my skin type, and leave my skin looking amazing without any irritation or breakouts.

I did a lot of research on vitamin c, which is a highly unstable compound and you can only reap it's full benefits if the ph matches closer to your natural skin's ph (5). Otherwise it will create an imbalance in your skin and will cause bad reactions.. such as infections, inflammation, redness, acne.

When I got to the questions asking if there was a company, why couldn't I find your website, and how could they get &#34;774&#34; reviews in 2013. BIG RED FLAG. The answer to the question about the website - they were working on a website, but why would you create on a website after over 774 reviews???? Wouldn't you create a website to promote your product? I looked at the website, but I don't think there was much information backing their 3 productions.<br /><br />I've been wondering about the section of their ad telling us to beware of low grade products out there. I've have over 20 years experience in sales, so this caught my eye. I've closed a lot of sales/deals over the years honestly and ethically, so I know how it works. But as they said in their own ad, there are dishonest people flooding the market with poor quality products.<br />I'm going over this again:<br />1. A company only one year old, or is there a company? Read the Q&A section.<br />2. Between 774 reviews in 2013<br /><br />Copied and pasted number &#34;3&#34; from their ad warning that there are poor quality products flooding the market. Could this be a scare or let's manipulate the customer into buying our product?<br />3. Beware of Generic Or Cheap Vitamin C Serum Here on Amazon<br /> There has been a large quantity of low quality Vitamin C serums flooding the market<br />OZ Naturals Vitamin C+E Serum Is A Highly Potent Anti Aging Serum That Will Give You<br /> Dramatic Results & Help Your Skin Look & Feel 10 Years Younger<br /><br />I copied and pasted number 4<br />4. Very Important...Read This:<br /> We Apologize If We're Sold Out. Because Of The Extremely High Demand For Our<br /> Vitamin C Serum, We Tend To Run Out Of Inventory Fast.<br /> Order Your Bottle Of OZ Naturals Vitamin C Serum Now While It's Still In Stock!<br />Doesn't number 4 remind you of some commercials we've seen on TV? This a common sales tactic to get people to hurry and buy because so many people are buying and we don't want to miss out.<br /><br />I don't know what to say about this information. Everyone has a right to make up their own mind.<br /><br />I'm writing this review in the hopes some will find it helpful in the purchases they make. I've wondered about some of the reviews I've read online with several products, as there are so many sometimes that they sound like random computer generated reviews. Reviews are meant to be a helpful tool for consumers and companies to promote their products, but I think there are a lot of reviews that have been made up as a sales tactic. I encourage everyone to be proactive once they find suspicious product claim or review. Write a review to alert customers of what you've found, so they can make an informed decision. Team work!<br /><br />Thank you for reading this, and I hope it helps.

Not one to usually spend more than $20 on a skincare product, I was weary of the efficacy of the product, but noticed relatively quickly that it was working. Those claiming that it is drying must not know about how the various ingredients interact with your skin. For example, I did enough research on this product prior to purchasing (I told you I'm weary of skincare products) that I knew well and good that the hyaluronic acid in it would dry out your face if you didn't apply moisturizer after it. As somebody with some early onset fine lines and wrinkles, as well as some hyper pigmentation from not treating my skin right earlier on, I'm extremely happy with the results. My fine lines and wrinkles have diminished a bit after my first month. They're not completely gone and I don't know that they'll be erased by this product, but they're certainly better and I imagine will continue to get better with more and more use. My skin is certainly brighter and my complexion has begun to even out. Again, I'm sure that will continue to get better with continued use. I read an article about whether or not C serums actually work and it noted that they do work, quite well actually, but you need to continue using them regularly for 3+ months to truly see the results you've heard about. So, I'll keep purchasing and keep using because the results I've seen so far are more than enough of a reason to keep this train rolling. I was so impressed with the serum that I went back and bought the Super Youth Moisturizer and the Retinol Serum. I'll review those once I feel I canadequately provide feedback, but for now, I'm confident with rating the C serum 5 stars and giving it a very strong recommendation.   857. This product had awesome claims and even better reviews. But I am now skeptical of it all. I noticed after using 3/4 of the product that it wasn't really giving me noticeable results (if it's a good vitamin c serum you can feel softer/smoother skin the next day). Usually once you open a vitamin c product it will oxidize (from exposure to air) and turn yellow. I noticed months later that the serum was still crystal clear. So, I tested it out & left the bottle completely open. 2 days later..still clear as air. Even if the product has stabalizers (ie vitamin e, etc) it should turn yellow given that it has Vitamin C. If this is a vitamin C serum then shouldn't it!? Makes me wonder what's in the product. If this review leaves you somewhat skeptical, open your bottle when you're near the end of it and see if yours oxidizes (it should).

  927. The product works a bit slower to fade dark marks than say, hydroquinone but for those of us who want to steer away from controversial products or want to go in a non-toxic direction, Vitamin C serum is an excellent alternative. In the past, I have used a hydroquinone product prescribed by a dermatologist as well as an OTC product and yes, the prescription product works faster in the short term but in the long run, it doesn't truly make my skin better. Also with hydroquinone, one has to be very careful how you use it and over what length of time as the effects can be damaging with long term use. Not so with Vitamin C. The product works slower for sure, but I actually feel as if it has made my skin better, in tone and texture as well. The fading of the dark marks is quite visible now after about a month of nightly use. The serum can be a tad drying but I follow up with an oil blend (of Rosehip Seed Oil, Sweet Almond Oil and a few drops of Lavender EO) and in the morning my skin feels soft. With the winter weather I suspect though that I could use an additional 'something' perhaps a cream(?) to truly seal in the moisture but my skin feels soft so I won't quibble about degrees of softness at this point. The company, OZ Naturals sent me an e-mail after I purchased this serum with detailed instructions on how to use to achieve the best results, which was great for me because I crave detail (as you can probably guess from my reviews). I also need to add that I apply Sunscreen at least 20 Minutes before going out. If you are trying to fade dark marks, in particular, you must use adequate sun protection or the dark marks could actually get darker, which would be the opposite of what you are trying to achieve. So a good sunscreen during the day is definitely a must!

  1136. First, I would like to stipulate that I used to be an avid Skin Ceutical consumer.<br /><br />I have reached my sixties, and although I have been told that \\"I really look pretty good for my age\\" I am like most women at this stage in that I have not escaped the inevitable fine lines and the onset of wrinkles. I chose this year to do something about this concern.<br /><br />First I went through a CO2 treatment to get rid of any sunspots that had accumulated over the years. Then I proceeded to use Retin A, along with a regiment of derma rolling (micro-needle therapy). I had previously used the Skin Ceutical Vitamin C E Ferulic Acid in the mornings, but I have now switched to Oz Naturals, and in the evenings, after my derma rolling session I am also using OZ Naturals Vitamin C Serum.<br /><br />I have given OZ Vitamin C serum a 5 star rating for a few different reasons.<br />1) The OZ Vitamin C serum does NOT sting my face. I apply this serum directly after an aggressive 10 minute session of derma rolling when my face is red and the skin is slightly raw. Even the Skin Ceutical serum stung, but with the Oz serum there is only a slight tingle as my skin is tightening.<br />2) I have not developed any allergic rash, welts or bumps<br />3) The benefits of the OZ serum seem to be exactly the same as my much more expensive Skin Ceutical serum.<br /><br />Now, this is why I chose to try the OZ naturals serum. Before I choose what to purchase I do read through the reviews, almost all of them including any 1, 2, and 3 star reviews. What I found impressive was that in many of the lower ratings a representative from Oz Naturals would reply under comments, often encouraging any dissatisfied customers to please call and speak directly to the OZ esthetician for personal support and help with the product. Customer service like this is to be commended. This shows a willingness to listen, help, and a true belief in their product. This impressed me enough to choose OZ Naturals over the other high rated serum products.<br /><br />Now for the last part of my lengthy review I would like to share some tips that I have learned both from both my research and personal experience:<br /><br />1) First of all, according to what I've read in many dissatisfied reviews, there is a misconception of what a face serum is used for.<br /> A serum is NOT a moisturizer. It has more of a face tightening property. A good moisturizer should be applied AFTER the serum has had a few moments to be absorbed into the skin.<br /><br />2) A serum will only help in conjunction with other skin care products and your healthy life-style. You need to stay hydrated, and get enough sleep, and we all know that sun, stress and environment plays a large part in the health of our skin.<br /> Think of it as getting ready for a special event. Buying a new dress is not all that is required for the event. There are shoes, accessories, a handbag, doing your hair, maybe painting your nails, and perhaps some make-up. The same is true for skin care products, working all together should get you some positive results over time.<br /><br />3) Please don't expect miracles within a few days, weeks or even months. If you think about it, a long fingernail that breaks is not going to grow the full length back in a day, nor is you hair going to grow 2 inches in a few weeks, and I think it's unrealistic to believe that someone is going to lose 50 lbs in a month. Well your skin is no different. Even with a professional face lift it takes quite a while for your face to heal and lose the numbness. The collagen in your face takes about a month for the cells to turnover. There are going to be some better days and worse days in between, but after a month you may see some small improvement, but usually so small that it's only apparent to you. However, in 4 to 6 months these monthly improvements add up to be significant for others to notice. So, be diligent in your skin care routine,and be patient. It will happen, everyone has different issues and needs and therefore experience different time periods before they see all the positive results that they are looking to receive.<br /><br />If you have taken the time to read through my rather lengthy review, I hope that it has been helpful, and encouraging.and be patient. It will happen, everyone has different issues and needs and therefore experience different time periods before they see all the positive results that they are looking to receive.<br /><br />If you have taken the time to read through my rather lengthy review, I hope that it has been helpful, and encouraging.

Since my skin is 40(-ish), it is also temperamental and can turn on me in a matter of seconds, so I have to be cautious when trying new skin products. This does not stop me in the slightest from trying new skin products, but I do have to be cautious... otherwise I might have a *slight* reaction which gives me an angry red rash all over my cheeks just in time for the Marine Corps ball, but that's another story.<br /><br />As noted in some previous reviews, this serum does seem to absorb quickly into my skin, so I started to use a bit more than I initially tried and had better results. My skin feels pretty good after I use this product, but it still needs additional moisture, so after it's fully absorbed I follow it up immediately with a moisturizer. I do this because I personally find it beneficial for my own skin type, but it may be something that others can consider doing for sufficient moisture.<br /><br />So far I really like how this serum is affecting my skin as it's softer and seems to have a better complexion. Also, note that it says your money will be refunded with no questions asked if it doesn't work, but apparently that simply means you can return it with in the standard Amazon 30 day window for returns. After that, they will not refund it even though it says you need to use it for at least 30 days to see results. So, if you aren't seeing any difference after 3.5 weeks, make sure to return it then. Edited to add an update: Because I take posting negative reviews for a product seriously, I continued using this product for 11 months to see if there would be any improvement over time. I still did not notice any difference. So, it may work for some but didn't work for me and I have switched back to using Olay Regenerist Serum which worked better for me.

  1413. I have an extensive skin care regimen consisting of various facial masks (sheet masks, clarifying/detox mixes, toning masks, you name it!), face washes (foaming, non-foaming, non-surfactant, black soap, and more), toners (rose water, witch hazel, orange blossom, SkinNutritions), and moisturizers (too many to name!), but I was relatively late to the game regarding serums. This serum dispenses precisely (because of the included glass dropper), won't degrade because of light exposure (because of the amber glass), and greatly benefits the skin (xcellent ingredients, AND the ingredient list provided by the seller also explains the benefit of each). I would highly recommend this product - I have added it between my toner and moisturizer (even on days when I wear makeup) and it hasn't interacted negatively with any other product.<br /><br />INGREDIENTS:Vitamin C. This antioxidant works by ridding skin of free radicals and protecting it from environmental aggressors like pollution. Vitamin C has been proven to stimulate the synthesis of collagen, which decreases as our sun exposure increases and as we age. Vitamin C also helps minimize scars, fine lines, and wrinkles. OZ Naturals uses a concentration of 20% Vitamin C because for most people, this percentage provides the best results without irritation. Hyaluronic Acid. This naturally occurring acid can hold 1,000 times its own weight in water, and that is the reason it's ideal for hydrating and moisturizing the skin. Our hyaluronic acid is botanically derived from Cassia Angustifolia seed. When used in conjunction with vitamin C, it helps assist in penetrating deeper into the skin's layers. Amino Blend. This blend promotes blood circulation to the skin, helping strengthen capillary walls and nourish cells, thereby allowing the skin to heal naturally. Since the epidermis layer of the skin absorbs this blend, it is often used to treat scars, acne, and wrinkles because it can help speed up cell regeneration making your skin appear more supple and youthful. Organic Jojoba Oil. Jojoba oil isn't really an oil, but rather it's a liquid wax that resembles human sebum (the oil that keeps your skin and hair smooth and supple) and is proven to smooth your skin's texture. OrganicHerbal Infusion, Organic Aloe, Vitamin C (Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate), MSM, botanical hyaluronic acid, Witch Hazel), Kosher Vegetable Glycerin, Carbomer, (2s)-2-Amino-5-guanidinopentanoic Acid, Kosher Vegetable Glycerin, Organic Jojoba Oil, Phenoxyethanol, Ethyl Hexyl Glycerin.appear more supple and youthful. Organic Jojoba Oil. Jojoba oil isn't really an oil, but rather it's a liquid wax that resembles human sebum (the oil that keeps your skin and hair smooth and supple) and is proven to smooth your skin's texture.   1494. I suffer from hyper pigmentation caused from birth control pills. Although my skin improved, I didn't feel like I was getting my money's worth. After five Fraxel treatments, I still had hyper pigmentation on my cheeks, and I finally accepted that this was something I would have to live with forever.<br /><br />After running out of Estee Lauder Even Skintone Illuminator, I decided to research comparative serum's. During my research I kept reading about the benefits of Vitamin C serum. Well this product was one of the highest rated and with the most reviews so I decided why not try it since I have tried everything else.<br /><br />I used OZ Naturals for 30 days and noticed a slight improvement to my skin. Nothing significant, but considering this was far less than what I was paying for Estee Lauder products, I decided to order another bottle. By this time, I discovered the benefits of derma rolling. The combination of a .5mm derma roller and vitamin C serum has made my skin look amazing. I still have discoloration, but it is definitely improving. So much so that one day out of the blue my husband told me that my skin looks really good.<br /><br />To be fair, I am going to list my entire skin care regimen. I wash my face twice a day with facial cleanser and a Clarasonic cleansing brush. Afterwards, I remove the excess soap with 100% witch hazel. I let the witch hazel dry completely before I apply vitamin C. Once the vitamin C has dried, I apply moisturizer and follow up with sun block. Two to three times a week, I use a .5mm derma roller on my face and neck. For me, combining all of these products has rendered the best results.<br /><br />FYI, there is no need to purchase expensive skin toner that only contains 50 - 70% witch hazel. Save the money and go to Walgreens and purchase a 16oz bottle of witch hazel for $6.re is no need to purchase expensive skin toner that only contains 50 - 70% witch hazel. Save the money and go to Walgreens and purchase a 16oz bottle of witch hazel for $6.
  1495. I love this product, I use the other brand on my face but when I put it on my neck it feels sticky, so I tried this and it feels so smooth and not tacky. When I have used it on my face it does at times make it feel dry and tight to combat this I use a moisturizing toner first then the serum and I'm good to go.

  1499. No noticeable benefits after more than two weeks of use -- in fact, quite the opposite. I have combination skin that's not dry -- just normal with a slightly oilier T-zone. I'd used SkinCeuticals C serum in the past with good results, but wanted to try something a bit less expensive, and that contained other beneficial ingredients as well, instead of just vitamin C alone. I was really surprised to discover that when I use this serum -- whether morning or night -- it seems to mask my skin's usual radiance, and makes it appear rough and dull. I decided to do a test to see if it was the serum or if my skin was just going through a bad phase, so I stopped using the C serum for a couple of days, and my skin went back to looking soft, smooth and radiant. So, I guess this C serum just isn't the right one for me, though it may work well for others. I since found out that my neighbor uses this serum, specifically because it helps dry out her oily skin (and I have to admit, her skin looks luminous and flawless!), so perhaps it is a bit drying for those with normal/combination skin. Though this serum doesn't work for me, it may be a winner for you if your skin is more on the oily side. 3/9/13 Update: I didn't want to toss this serum just because it was drying out my face, so I started using it on the back of my hands at night, followed with my usual hand lotion. I've always taken good care of my hands, but this serum has definitely improved the texture and tone of the skin on the back of my hands and faded a few freckles. It also didn't cause any dryness like it did on my face, so I'm glad I didn't give up on it entirely!

Perhaps it's because it's a bit inexpressive that they can't provide truly high quality Vitamin C. I was turned on to [[ASIN:B003H1MYF8 this Vitamin C]] by a dermatologist, and I must say it has been far more effective for my skin type. If you're skeptical I recommend trying a few options and testing all of them to see the real results you'll get from each. It is a time intensive process but it's the only way to know which Vitamin C is truly good and which ones are not.<br /><br />Some things to look out for:<br />- Any company claiming to remove wrinkles - these are likely fake. The best Vitamin C products can reduce fine lines, but will not get rid of them completely.<br />- Vitamin C is not a moisturizer, any product claiming to be a moisturizer is likely not good. Vitamin C helps lock in the moisture and when paired with the right moisturizer increases that moisturizers effectiveness.<br />- Lastly make sure to choose wisely, there is no cost too great when it comes to protecting your skin.

All I could think was, \\"I just spilled $6 worth of serum!!!\\" They definitely need better caps that stay closed. I received a quick response letting me know that they were considering updating their formula again due to feedback they have received...&quot;considering&quot; and not giving me a date as to when and if they would change...I'm so disappointed that I have to start my search over for a new product. Old review for the non-Pro-Astax version:It exceeded my realistic expectations. I love this stuff and will continue to use it. My skin just drinks it in, it absorbs almost instantly, a drop or two is all you need. I have very easily irritated skin. I had no stinging, no redness. The skin on my face is smoother, softer and the pores less noticeable. I've been using it for about three weeks, I'm looking forward to seeing what happens over the next three. Even if this is as good as it gets, I'm very pleased and hooked! I don't look twenty years younger...but I don't believe any product can do that. Bottom line is that I saw a noticeable improvement and love it!

It is a factor I personally consider to be important, because certain smells are migraine triggers.<br />I also detest oily products, so I was relieved that this serum seeps into the skin without leaving an oily residue on the skin or my fingers.The company uses natural, organic ingredients, the products are not tested on animals and they offer a money back guarantee. The bottle has a pipette attached to the cap, which then can be used to drop the serum onto the hands/fingers to rub into the skin.<br />I have noticed an improvement on old facial scars and age marks. You should allow the serum to absorb into the skin before putting anything else on your face.<br />I am surprised by the results after just one month and will be interested to see the long term outcome of using this product, which my daughter is also enthusiastic about.<br />I received a free sample of this product courtesy of OZ Naturals.

First let me mention, several other reviews, complained about the dropper versus a pump top, I prefer the dropper, it allows you much more control over the amount you are using. As a senior female, I have problems everywhere, lol. My hands and arms look twice as old as the rest of me, so I started using this product on my hands, and arms. WOW most of the brown spots have just gone away! My hands look like they belong to a living person now. I started using it on my face, and can honestly say I can see improvement there also. My forehead saw results first, then the crowfeet around my eyes are better, the deep lines, I guess they are going to take the longest to show improvement, but after seeing the way my hands improved, well I know this product works, no miracle but it was nice to see a real improvement. Will post later after I have been using this longer. Have only tried one other product, but it left a film on skin, did not like that, so I have little experience with other products, but I do like this one, not sure if I would be willing to try something else. Hope everyone also has good experiences with this product.

Distilled water and glycerin are easy to find in local drugstores. The ascorbic acid powder is available on Amazon and recipes for the varying concentrations are easy to find online. If you make it yourself, you'll know the concentration, you can be sure it's fresh and you'll save tons of money.<br />Hope this helps.

Originally, I purhased this for my mother to help her combat her aging skin but at the same time I wanted to try it out for myself before I gave it to her. I have very dry skin that is prone to breakouts and I needed something which would help me get smooth, oil free shiny skin in the winter months. After using this for almost a month now, I am very happy with the results. I apply this as directed and once it dries I apply my favorite st. Ives moisturizer on top. I can honestly say its better than buying any of those high end creams and lotions. My skin looks radiant, it has a glow. No more dry skin, and I can step out the house with my bare face!

  2278. I have now used this product for two weeks so I figured that is a long enough time to write a proper review of the product.<br /><br />Just a bit of background: I am a 27 yr old male, decent skin but have some smile lines and lines on my forehead from tanning for 4 years strait almost every day ( in tanning booths... I know stupid move, but I was in college and liked being tan ;) Over the past two years I have noticed my skin was not as bright as it used to be, also I had some darkness under my eyes ( Sun damage I suspect).<br /><br />I used this product every morning and night for the first week, than just at night for the second. I can honestly say my smile lines are not as prominent as they were ( there still there though). I also have to say this lightened by under-eye area ( did not completely remove the darkness). Keep in mind my darkness came from sun damage, i'm not so sure it would work for hereditary darkness. Other positives include that my skin is very soft, it evened my skin tone quite well and brightened by skin tone as well.<br /><br />Negatives: Since it is &#34;Brightening&#34; and I am decently fair skinned, this definitely makes your face pale. I combat that by using a self tanning spray on my face 1-3x a week. It also has not completely gotten rid of my smile lines or the deeper lines on my forehead... but it also has only been two weeks.<br /><br />Conclusion: For $30 this will last about two months if you are using it just at night... $15 a month is definitely worth it for this stuff. Is it going to erase deep wrinkles and lines, definitely not, but it probably will make them less noticeable. If your looking to erase years off your face get Botox, fillers or plastic surgery. If your looking for a decent boost for your skin, than this is for you!

  2322. Let me give you a little background on my complexion issues. I am a 30 year old mother of one child, and never suffered from acne until I was pregnant. Ever since then, 8 years ago, I have gotten pimples usually around that time of the month, or when I'm stressed out. Last January I started getting worse acne, but I got a handle on it and it went away. Then this Summer I moved and started getting worse acne than I've ever had. I would get pimples that hung around for months, literally months, that would flame up randomly and just ruined my complexion completely. I did a little research and discovered that those &#34;pimples&#34; were probably hyperpigmentation, because they didn't stick out and were just red splotches on my face left over from the pimples. I did what I usually do and researched the heck out of reviews for different products on Amazon that mentioned hyperpigmentation, and came upon this stuff. I first use acne face wash (la roche posse), dry my face, then apply this and let this dry before either letting it go before bed or applying moisturizer if I am going out for the day. After the very first night my hyperpigmentation reduced. After a week or two some of it has completely disappeared. The really bad ones are still there but barely visible. I even got a pimple on my chest, which never happens, and applied this overnight and it was GONE by morning. This stuff is amazing. My face looks healthier and feels fantastic, my complexion is back to normal, and I am one happy girl!

Which works.<br />It is clear, a little thicker than water.<br />I use it after using cerave cleanser and my clairsonic. I have read that instead of just rubbing serums on your face, you should be pressing it in to your face to get it in your pores.<br />It's refreshing when you put it on. It takes about 5 minutes for it to completely dry. Once it dries it tightens your face just slightly. Not as much as a toner would.<br />I have been using this product for about 3 months. I have noticed an difference in the elasticity of my skin and a significant decrease in dark spots.<br />Now you can find a plethora of vitamin c serums on Amazon and at the beauty counter. It feels like water and it dries almost immediately, leaving a thin film that you can notice, but is not uncomfortable nor leaves my skin dry.   2645. I have just finished 1 bottle that I purchased a month and half ago. I used it once or twice daily. The customer service of OZ Naturals seems courteous that I received a thank-you email from them upon my order, which explained in detail how to use the product. .<br /><br />The suggested direction is that you put it AFTER your toner. However, I after some uses, I found that the suggestion was NOT for everyone - people with specific personal skincare routine will have to figure out themselves where in the course of the routine this product is to be incorporated.<br /><br />This product is a thin serum that dries quickly within seconds of the application onto the skin. You don't need to put it a lot but just make a thin sheet of this serum over the face and neck or wherever you would like. You put some drops in your palm and by using the fingertip of the other hand, tap it into the area of concern.<br /><br />*** The timing is important ***<br />In my own experience, this product should be applied BEFORE the toner. I have my personal skincare routine for 15 years that consists of:<br />(1) Booster 1 (liquid) - special \\"booster\\" skincare product that is best absorbed onto the clean skin before the toner<br />(2) Toner (liquid) - to condition and prepare the skin for the next product<br />(3) Booster 2 (semi-liquid) - another booster skincare that is a little thicker in consistency so that it is best applied after the toner has been applied to tighten the skin pore to prevent the moisturizer from clogging.<br />(4) Moisturizer (cream) - to seal the skin with nourishing and moisturizing cream<br /><br />This product is an ACID with hydrophilic Vitamin C and dries up your skin. I used to use it in the process (3), and even after the moisturizer, it dried my skin and made it feel very tight. After 2 weeks, I had this discomfort and no visible benefit on my skin despite that the review says that I should see some improvement in the skin after the first application.<br /><br/>So I changed the order and use it in the process (1) - right after washing and towel-drying my face and BEFORE my toner. THIS WORKED. The acidic serum quickly gets absorbed into the skin and by the time I'm preparing the next toner, it's dried, so the skin can receive the next liquid. The toner will help ease the dryness caused by the acidic serum and condition the skin for the next. With this order, I no longer felt any discomfort from drying and tightening sensation.<br /><br />Since the serum is applied in the very first step of the skincare routine, it gets absorbed completely before the toner tightens the pore and seal the surface.<br /><br />In the next 2 weeks, I began seeing the visible sigh of skin improvement. The folds of the skin from the nose to the corners of the mouth have become less and less visible. The skin complexion has also improved by eliminating some small sun spots and evening out the skin tone.<br /><br />After finishing 1 bottle which lasted about a month and half, I can say I am happy with the product.<br /><br />Note that this product is an ACID so it is NOT very good idea to use after Derma Roller treatment as suggested by some websites/reviews. It will BURN your treated skin and make your face all red and swollen - not from the Derma Roller treatment but from the acid on the micro-injuries on the skin. The skin will return normal in 24 hours but not in 12 hours - so if you had a Derma Roller treatment at night and put this product to burn your face, you will have to go to work with red-angry-puffy face in the morning.<br /><br />Rather, I would recommend this product for just a regular daily skincare purpose.

  2690. I have been using this product (provided to me for review) for a couple of weeks. Do I see miraculous changes? No. Did I expect to see such? No.<br /><br />My approach to skincare is rather scattershot, perhaps because there is no known science here, only marketing claims; I'm not willing to spend hundreds of dollars on fanciful advertising, nor am I willing to experiment with potentially toxic chemicals. So, I aim for products that<br /><br />1. Don't contain chemicals considered hazardous or unhealthful on the Environmental Working Group's Skin Deep database (Yes, I know it's not the last word on certain ingredients, but for now it's the best I have)<br />2. Do contain ingredients that make some bit of scientific sense (such as Vitamin C, Vitamin E, hyaluronic acid, etc.<br />3. Feel good on the skin<br />4. Have no annoying odors<br />5. Are easy to apply<br />6. At least fool me into seeing some benefit on my inevitably aging skin<br /><br />I recently received three OZ Naturals products for trial, and I'm pretty happy with all three: this Vitamin C serum, the Super Youth Eye Gel, and the Hyaluronic acid. (Of the three, the eye gel is my least favorite, but only because I prefer an eye cream; this gel dries quickly and feels very dry. Maybe it's doing what it's supposed to, but for those who are looking for more moisture, this might not fit the bill.)<br /><br />Regarding the four-star rating, I give most \\"skin-care\\" product four stars simply because it's difficult to know if it's actually \\"working.\\" I did not knock off a star due to any features of the product.

  2708. UPDATE: Not the type of Vitamin C you want! After not being terribly satisfied with the results of this serum I did some further, very extensive, research regarding Vitamin C serum for the face. As a result I discovered that the Vitamin C \\"Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate\\" contained in this product is not the best for your face. I switched to what I have found is a MUCH BETTER product for me. I'm using ADVANCED SKIN CARE Vitamin C Serum. It contains 20% Vitamin C+e, Ferulic Acid & Hyaluronic Acid. The Vitamin C in ADVANCED SKIN CARE is \\"L Ascorbic Acid\\" which is what you want, AA is the water soluble, biologically active form of vitamin C found in nature. AA is the form the body uses to build skin, repair wounds, and protects the skin from disease and disorders. Watch out for Vitamin C in other forms such as \\"Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate\\", as OZ Naturals contains.

  2722. The key ingredients in OZ Naturals' Anti-Aging Serum are vitamin C, an amino blend, and hyaluronic acid. According to my research:<br />* Studies have found Vitamin C to be most effective in protecting against damage induced by UV light and also effective in the treatment of photodamage and/or skin wrinkling.<br />* Amino acids are important to skin health, repairing and generating new cells, and stimulating the buildup of collagen. If you are deficient in these amino acids, your skin will not be able to retain water and may lose its elasticity and show signs of aging.<br />* Hyaluronic acid helps the cells in your skin absorb and retain moisture. Hyaluronic acid (HA) is a biopolymer naturally occurring is the skin and other tissues. Babies have a high level of HA (hence that soft, supple skin!) and as we age, we have less and less (hence the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles!).<br /><br />The Vitamin C + Amino Blend + Hyaluronic Acid Professional Anti-Aging Serum is my favorite OZ Naturals product. I like that is made in the USA, 98% natural, and 72% organic. I also like that it comes in a dark bottle with a dropper lid for easy dispensing and application. It is somewhat thick, but goes on smoothly and does not leave my skin feeling sticky or tight like some other serums I tried did. This was my first OZ Naturals product that I tried, and I truly saw a difference in my skin after a few months of continued use.<br /><br />As someone who frequently breaks out from skin care products, I was pleased to find that I experienced no breakouts from OZ Naturals' Vitamin C + Amino Blend + Hyaluronic Acid Professional Anti-Aging Serum. Yet perhaps the best testament to this product (and the other OZ Naturals products I have been using--please see my other reviews if you are interested) came just a few days ago, when someone asked me, \\"What have you been using on your skin? I don't have any actual wrinkles, although I do have minor fine lines and expression lines. It made the former less noticeable, although the latter--hmm, dunno if anything can be done about them (I am thin and have little subcutaneous fat, and in addition the years--and decreasing collagen--are catching up to me). :-( Again, I cannot definitively say if THIS serum is doing all that or if it is more of a concerted effort, but whatever it is, it WORKS! **UPDATE** It helps shrink basal cell tumors--yes I know it sounds crazy. I went to the skin cancer doctor and she pointed out that a spot on the back of my neck (which is hard to see without a mirror) &#34;looks like a basal cell cancer&#34;. She wanted to take it off, but because it was likely not a deadly type of cancer she said that it was okay to wait two months and if it grew in size, she recommended having it removed. My mindset about medical care is that a healthy lifestyle and diet is your first line of defense, meaning physical therapy, conditioning, diet, supplements, and what is used on your skin. To me, if that fails, that is when medical intervention is necessary. So I went home to keep an eye on the spot. It started to look bigger, so I scheduled the appointment. In between making the appointment and going to it (they were booked up), I thought I might try using this, since it is so good for your skin, and Vitamin C has a lot of antioxidants. So I got a waterproof bandaid, soaked the pad in the Vitamin C serum, and put it on the suspicious-looking spot. I left it on there for two weeks, and when I took it off, it was remarkably smaller in size. So I canceled myappointment and put on another waterproof bandaid soaked in the Vitamin C Serum. After another week, it was hardly noticeable. It hasn't completely gone away yet, but the results are very very noticeable! I will update later. ****UPDATE 11/22/2015**** I have been very satisfied with this product for some time, but my most recent shipment was very runny, not thick like it usually is. So I ordered again; same consistency. Apparently they changed their formulation. I can't yet say if this changes the product's effectiveness, but it is harder to apply. :-(

We will see how this works in terms of anti-aging though. So far the vit E oil and lotion seems to do more for hydration than this serum.

  3099. This serum is incredible. I believe this serum has such high reviews because it is one of those rare beauty products that actually creates a visible effect on your skin. And we all love to SEE the results in our skin.<br /><br /> I knew vitamin c was a good skin care product, but when I ordered this serum I had no idea how well my skin would react. It lightens, brightens, and heals. Really. Try it for yourself. I have a dark mark on my stomach that has continued to lighten with the use of this product. Same with freckles (after I saw the first spot lighten overnight, I had to keep going-it was addicting!). However, I have not had any spot completely disappear. Just lighten by several shades. And from what I understand, you MUST use a good SPF during the day after using this or the sun will just darken all the areas you have worked to lighten.<br /><br />And lastly- I had a major sunburn recently- bright red skin, blistering up- and this freaking serum calmed my skin down overnight. It actually has helped to heal the skin from my sunburn faster- who knew?! I am talking about the blisters, which would normally lead to pealing skin, went away or decreased in size overnight!<br /><br />I used every last drop of this serum and have just reordered. It is a great bargain and is highly effective. The ingredient list has a lot of natural and organic ingredients listed (which I suppose it what this brand is all about being called OZ naturals after all) and if you compare it to other serums on the market, you will see a difference in ingredients.<br /><br />Ingredients are usually listed in order of weight/volume/prevalence, so the first ingredients are what makes up most of the serum and the last ingredients listed are usually too minimal to make much difference with your skin. Here there are quality ingredients listed at the top (organic herbal infusion, organic aloe, vitamin c are the top 3). You'd be surprised how many vitamin c serums are out there that list vitamin c/ascorbic acid as an afterthought as one of the last few ingredients on the list. So watch out for marketing ploys and learn to read ingredient lists! This stuff works though and is worth a try.
  3100. It has been about 30 days since my purchase of this serum, I have to say that my face looks brighter and my acne scars have faded.   3143. Good stuff. Black don't crack but definitely like to maintain the luster when I can. I used OZ Naturals for 30 days and noticed a slight improvement to my skin. Nothing significant, but considering this was far less than what I was paying for Estee Lauder products, I decided to order another bottle. By this time, I discovered the benefits of derma rolling. The combination of a .5mm derma roller and vitamin C serum has made my skin look amazing. I still have discoloration, but it is definitely improving. So much so that one day out of the blue several people told me that my skin looks really good. To be fair, I am going to list my entire skin care regimen. I wash my face twice a day with facial cleanser and a Clarasonic cleansing brush. Afterwards, I remove the excess soap with 100% witch hazel. I let the witch hazel dry completely before I apply vitamin C. Once the vitamin C has dried, I apply moisturizer and follow up with sun block. Two to three times a week, I use a .5mm derma roller on my face and neck. For me, combining all of these products has rendered the best results. FYI, there is no need to purchase expensive skin toner that only contains 50 - 70% witch hazel. Save the money and go to Walgreens and purchase a 16oz bottle of witch hazel for $6.

  3158. What's the percentage of the vitamin C? Why is it only one kind of vitamin C in the ingredient? What is the PH? This kind of vitamin C oxidizes quickly no mater what 'stabilizer' is used. Anyone benefiting from the product is benefitting from the Hyaluronic acid, MSM, AND E . 2-3 weeks on the shelf and the bottle is already at 50% strength of vitamin C it was formulated at. How long did it take to get from the factory to the store? How long until the store brought it out from their backend shelf to the display?<br />The only vitamin C that penetrates deep into the skin and DOESN'T oxidize quickly is tetrahexyldecyl ascorbate, which is fat soluble.<br />Women wize up! You can make your own topical vitamin C with ascorbic acid. It's cheap, It's pure, water soluble, and easy. You can add E and MSM to it. Get litmus papers to adjust the ph. A whole year's supply and more for the same cost of one of these bottles.

  3300. I just got off the phone with Amazon because similar to some 1-star comments that I have read so far, I noticed a pattern of product descriptions, reviews, pictures and ingredients – all worded exactly the same among a handful of companies. I have made a list of 20+ beauty companies on Amazon that I ultimately believe is 1 company, pedaling mislabeled and harmful products to Amazon customers by lying about ingredients and padding their reviews. OZ Naturals is at the top of the list!<br /><br />I called Amazon because this infuriates me! These beauty products are expensive and as a consumer who doesn’t want to throw money away, I felt cheated. I rely on Amazon for almost everything I need and I use their review system on a daily basis for items I even want to buy in a store. I read reviews thoroughly and I do my research before every purchase, big or small. Calling a company fraudulent, or in this case 25 companies, is a hefty claim that needs backing. I’m no Erin Brockovich and I don’t have a chemistry lab at home, so I should stick to what I can prove in order to make a legitimate claim, such as Ingredients and Mislabeling of Products.<br /><br />For instance: this product in particular - OZ Naturals ‘The Best Vitamin C Serum For Your Face’, claims that it is completely Natural and Organic. However, their product which is actually called “The Best Vitamin C Serum … “ contains Vitamin C (Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate) which IS NOT the best Vitamin C. Vitamin C (Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate) is a SYNTHETICALLY DERIVED version of Vitamin C. What people want in skin care products is vitamin C (L-Ascorbic Acid), the purest form of Vitamin C. Also, this is a skin product but it contains Ethyl Hexyl Glycerin, which is a KNOWN SKIN IRRITANT that can possibly damage and irritate eyes and is known to cause dermatitis. Many of the &#34;natural&#34; and &#34;organic&#34; companies use this as an alternative to parabens as a preservative, but no matter what their label claims, it is not a natural preservative. So I find it very hard to believe that this product actually received 4,173 reviews and maintains almost a 5 star rating? That is not even close to being possible! Not one single iPhone listing on Amazon even got close to 2,000 reviews and everyone has a cell phone.<br /><br />My list goes on and on with these companies. So far I have definitely identified OZ Naturals, OZ Shape, and InstaNaturals as companies that have Blatantly lied with regards to their ingredients. With any of OZ Naturals Retinol products, which claim to have 2.5% Retinol Cream, they don't even contain Retinol and that is not even listed as an ingredient. Instead, it's made with retinyl palmitate, an ester of retinol, a far inferior derivative. To make a long story short, I believe that all of these beauty companies on Amazon with astronomical ratings are all the same company with fake reviews based on inferior products and ingredients. There are people who have commented that they got cysts, rashes, and breakouts just from using some of these skin care items.<br /><br />I called Amazon today and said exactly what I just typed. I also noted the enormous amount of reviews these companies received (which all sound exactly the same among products with different company names), yet no one has actually heard of them or seen their products in the store. I encourage anyone else who notices the same pattern to call Amazon. It is simply not right that a sub-par-conglomerate-company ruin the Amazon review system that the rest of us rely on. I do not appreciate these companies taking advantage of people and stealing their money. If these companies are lying about the actual listed ingredients that we can see on Amazon, who is to say what these moisturizers, serums and creams actually do contain?<br /><br />If anyone is still reading this, Please call Amazon! And definitely don't order this product!<br /><br />Yuck in a bottle!

  3328. Given the high expectations set forth by the claims of this product, I was a bit disappointed. Then again, I suppose there's no magical cream you can put on your skin and suddenly expect it to improve drastically. As long as you have realistic expectations, you'd be satisfied with this product.<br /><br />Assuming you follow a regular skincare regimen (cleanser, toner, moisturizer), you're supposed to apply the serum between the toner and the moisturizer. The cool thing about serums is that you only really need a couple drops for your entire face, so the 1 oz bottle can actually last quite a while. Since the bottle comes with a eye dropper type of dispenser, it's very easy to limit how much you use each time.<br /><br />For the serum itself, there's a very light smell-nothing too strong or offensive, and upon application, there's a very relaxing cooling sensation. There's no ingredients here that would dry your skin or anything, so it should be fine for all skin types. I find that it works best to apply it right before sleeping, though many apply it in the mornings as well. It does contain a plethora of skin-boosting ingredients, and the label claims that it's 72% organic, though I have no way of verifying that.<br /><br />Overall, I can't guarantee that this bottle will magically make you look younger or anything, but it does do a great job of moisturizing the face. As always, the best way to have healthy looking skin is by having a combination of a healthy diet as well as a healthy skincare regimen, and it can't hurt to add this to your daily skincare routine.<br /><br />I'll keep this review updated as I continue to use the serum and note any significant differences.<br />-Note that I was given a review sample

  3386. The serum comes in an amber glass container, which protects against oxidation. The lid is a medicine dropper for dispensing the clear liquid. The serum has a light scent, but I can’t really describe it.I used it on my forehead, cheeks, and around my mouth. I had some fine lines and wrinkles I was trying to make less evident, and also some spots on my cheeks. I didn’t want to just drop the serum on my face with the medicine dropper, so I put some on a Qtip and applied it to my face. It doesn’t take much serum to cover all those spots. I only used about 4 drops for my entire face. The serum spreads nicely and the scent doesn’t stick around. Since you have to wait for it to dry, I apply it before brushing my teeth. It doesn’t take long to dry; when I’m done brushing my teeth, it’s dry, and then I apply my moisturizer. My moisturizer goes on very easily and I don’t have to use very much because the serum is a delivery system for ingredients.After using the serum for 12 days,I do think my skin looks brighter and more youthful. Also, the spots on my cheek aren’t as dark anymore, which makes my skin tone more even. My teenage daughter agrees that my skin looks brighter. That’s good because next week we go back to school/work and maybe my 2nd graders will stop telling me I look like a grandma now! One can only hope.

Let me say a little about myself...I'm a 48 year old female, white, blue eyes and take exceptional care of my skin. The feedback I receive from others (unsolicited) is they are amazed when I tell them my real age. I apparently look like someone who is in her early 30's. It's very nice to hear but I'm not quite drinking the Koolaid. haha! I am a firm believer in taking fish oil daily for healthy hair, skin and nails...and I have brainwashed myself into thinking it has heart health benefits, too. The main reason I take fish oil (Nordic Naturals Ultimate Omega) is because I don't eat enough fish on a weekly basis, so there is a need for me to use a supplement. I also take a daily multi-vitamin supplement (because I find it impossible to get all of those vitamins in my daily consumption of relatively healthful food). My skin care is all on my own. I wish I could spend $$$ with my derma doctor on some advanced skin treatments for those little lines around my eye area and get a V-beam treatment for my rosacea but that is not happening right now. I wash my face with a creamy low suds face wash, blot dry and then apply serum (let dry for a minute), face cream (SPF 50 in the AM and one without SPF at night), a good eye cream and I use a Clarsonic 2x weekly (I think too much use can be irritating to my rosacea). So, that's my background.<br /><br />Now onto the serum. After reading about the benefits of vitamin c, it's supposed to help break up those evil brown spots, overall brighten the skin and even out skin tone. I started with the Oz Naturals product first because it features 20% Vitamin C (very potent) + Amino Complex + Hyaluronic Acid, using it twice daily on my face, neck and decolletage. I finished the Oz Naturals bottle. There was a VERY noticeable difference in the brown spots on my face...they actually faded a good amount! It also did a good job in helping reduce redness from my rosacea (which I am cursed with) and brightened up and evened out my skin. I decided that I'd do additional research and try a different brand that also had very good reviews which was the Lilian Frache brand. I finished the bottle, using it twice daily on my face, neck and decolletage. I think it somewhat maintained the results of the Oz Naturals but I think my skin back peddled a bit. I am not convinced it's as good as Oz. The LF bottle is finished and I will not repurchase. Hands down, I am now repeating a purchase of the Oz Naturals serum because IT IS THAT GOOD!!! I get nice results from it. I highly recommend you try it and see for yourself. Cheers!

  3478. Everybody reaches for the vitamin C when cold season is around and the benefits to boosting the immune system are established. But with all the emphasis on `age reversal' (or at least retarding) other aspects of ascorbic acid are in the spotlight. Vitamin C (aka ascorbic acid) is key to the production of collagen, a protein that aids in the growth of cells and blood vessels and gives skin its firmness and strength and helps your skin repair itself. It is an antioxidant that slows the rate of free-radical damage - free radicals are unstable molecules that damage collagen and cause skin dryness, fine lines and wrinkles.<br /><br />Now, place OZ Naturals high dose (20%) Vitamin C serum coupled with Vegan hyaluronic acid on your face and all the `science info' becomes visible - almost immediately. Oz Naturals has a fine line of products and combining them or finding the particular ones that work best with your skin type (Fitzpatrick + quality of moisture inherent in your own skin) will give you near instantaneous satisfaction and the appearance of younger integument. Grady Harp, August 14

  3562. So far so good. I've only had it a couple of days, but I can tell that it's working. I like the way that the formula isn't sticky and how it doesn't have a strong scent to it. I've used others that did the same, but left my skin feeling tacky. It lasts about a full day for me and by the time I go to bed, you can tell the skin is definitely back to what it was pre-use, so I will have to continue using if I want to keep up this façade. :) I also use this under a different brand's moisturizer and have not had any bad side effects or rashes. That may depend how strong the chemicals are in your moisturizer though. I experimented with the combo on my hand before I tried on my face. Overall I am not sure it'll give me the &#34;results I've been looking for&#34; because that would be a permanent solution to end the signs of aging (which there is no such thing), however I've found this as a good solution to temporarily reduce the signs without having to resort to risky Botox.   3586. This is great for your skin. I did some research, and vitamin c helps even out skin tone, and also helps build collagen for firmer skin. So it's great for the health of your skin. One caution - keep it in the refrigerator so it stays fresh and effective, vitamin c is not terribly stable so it's not that it will go \\"bad,\\" it just won't work as well for your skin if you leave it at room temperature for too long. I've used this with a variety of skin care, and it works with other creams and cleansers, so you can add it to your skin care routine without any problems. I would put this on first, it absorbs very well and quickly, then you can put on your cream or sunscreen or whatever you use. Don't use too much, it will make your skin sticky and when you put on make up or creams, it won't go on smoothly and you'll end up with residue on your face. I use it every day and I've tried it in the morning and at night. I don't see any difference in effects if you use it at either time, I found that at night after a shower works better for me. I did use it both in the morning and at night for awhile, but I didn't see any greater benefits using it twice a day, once a day has worked very well. I like this because it adds an essential vitamin that your skin needs to be healthy. And it really works - I had dark spots on my face, and they have gotten a lot lighter after using one bottle. I really recommend it, just keep it in the fridge. Using this product got me to look into other products that give skin vitamins, etc., and I found this [[ASIN:B007VEPVZC Bel Essence - (2oz) 100% All-Natural, Organic Anti-Wrinkle Oil Treatment with Argan, Grapeseed and Avocado Oil]] - this adds to the vitamin c serum with more vitamins and fatty acids, omega 3's, and the two products have made such a difference in my skin - it's softer, the lines around my eyes (including under my eyes) are gone, my frown lines are much much much lighter, and the fine lines around my lips (especially onmy upper lip) are gone. My dark spots have faded to being barely noticeable, my skin stays hydrated all day, and my skin tone has really improved. I am getting compliments about the \\"glow\\" my skin has, and how refreshed and younger I look. Plus I know I'm giving my skin healthy ingredients to make it better. If you are into natural and healthy, you can't beat these two.

As far as I know, all vitamin C serums oxidize, I've used a recognized brand in the past, skinceuticals, which did turn yellow and so I contacted the company to ask if the product had gone bad and they told me that it is completely normal for vitamin C serums to turn oxidize, turning yellow, and that it doesn't not mean that the product is not good, specially because it turns pretty quickly, I only had the product for a couple of weeks and did hide it from any sort of lighting as they recommend it. With that said, that's the reason why I don't know if this product is good or not, the results from using vitamin C comes with time, all I know is that this product does not feel like water, it does have a thicker consistency like the other vitamin C serums I've used in the past, also, when I put it in my face it feels like it hydrates it right away.
